conclusion: Analyze the processes involved in the cycle using the first law of thermodynamics.
The cycle consists of four processes: adiabatic expansion (c → d), isochoric cooling (d → a), adiabatic compression (a → b), and isochoric heating (b → c).
Adiabatic Expansion (c → d): No heat exchange (Q = 0), internal energy decreases (ΔU < 0).
Isochoric Cooling (d → a): No work done (W = 0), heat is released (Q < 0).
Adiabatic Compression (a → b): No heat exchange (Q = 0), internal energy increases (ΔU > 0).
Isochoric Heating (b → c): No work done (W = 0), heat is absorbed (Q > 0).
Heat Absorbed (Q_in) occurs during isochoric heating (b → c).
Heat Released (Q_out) occurs during isochoric cooling (d → a).
Use the first law of thermodynamics: ΔU_cycle = Q_in - Q_out + W_cycle.
For a complete cycle, ΔU_cycle = 0, so 0 = Q_in - Q_out + W_cycle.
Since the cycle is clockwise, W_cycle > 0, so Q_in - Q_out = -W_cycle < 0.
The amount of heat absorbed is less than the amount of heat released during the complete cycle.
